result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Franklin Thomas Geffers

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Franklin Thomas Geffers in court.  Attorney Michelle A. Wenninger in court for Franklin Thomas Geffers.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel's first appearance.  Discovery rec'd and awaiting additional discovery. 
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
(Copy mailed to Defendant and Defendant's Attorney)
Amended to correct spelling of Defendant's first name; Absolute sobriety; Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription

Defendant Franklin Thomas Geffers in court.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def has been unable to retain counsel and req court appointed atty.  Court appoints Atty Wenninger.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $40 per month commencing 9-15-22.  Court has def sign amended bond correcting his first name.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
22R 015099 Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #15893 on 8/2/22
Absolute sobriety; Not possess/use any controlled substance without valid prescription

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Franklin Thomas Geffers in court. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def is unsure about retaining counsel.  Court sets $350 cash bond, previously posted.  Court enters NG pleas on behalf of def.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
